Comments_List: I developed many of the core skills necessary to perform syntheses in an organic chemistry laboratory.
I strengthened my lab skills and learned a lot more about my academic processes and which studying methods work best for me.

Strength: good organization, good learning curve
Weaknesses: EPs were really annoying to do, not enough focus on the chemistry theory

The sheer number of post laboratory assignments, and the crunched time frame made it difficult to devote the necessary time to the actual organic chemistry class that accompanies this laboratory course. With that said, the setup--the experiments, the course packet descriptions, etc. were great.

The only weakness is that the procedures were sometimes vague. This was a minor issue, because most of the procedures were very well laid out. Overall, the class took a difficult subject and made it understandable.
Sure, it's a good course to become more familiar with orgo lab techniques. They really become second nature to you.
Yes! I love organic chemistry lab.
Yes, this was a very fun, albeit time-consuming course to take. A necessary class for anyone going into STEM fields, in my opinion.
Yes, this class was amazing and very interesting.
